title: VSCode Python Extension: Extension have ended surprisingly
content:
Running the latest version of VSCode: 1.61.2 in Windows 10. Everything was working fine until Yesterday when my Python extension gave me this error "Extension host terminated unexpectedly" and I'm unable to run or debug Python files in VSCode.

I did a complete removal of VSCode (including the App, the code folder in AppData, and the .vscode folder). But when I reboot, reinstall and run VSCode and install the Python extension by Microsoft v2021.10.1365161279, I get the exact same error.

It seems like this should just work as it has for me for many years. Is there any way to find out what is breaking it?

I can successfully open and run Python files in remote WSL instances using VSCode, just not in Windows.

[Edit: The problem turns out to be Mozilla VPN services. If I exclude VSCode from it, then the Python extension works.]
creator: cloudytechi147

What is a way to do this? If it's not possible in vanilla Firefox, is there an extension available for this?

title: Firefox synced the old Bookmarks in to the new PC
content: This is the problem I have now. I have two PC,s, a main desktop PC and a laptop, which I don't use often and where the Firefox has an outdated bookmarks on it. Now somehow my PC removed my actual bookmarks and replace it with the one old one from my laptop, (which I just used for the last two days). This is a huge problem! You need to offer a setting where you set a main PC and the other one to sync upon the main PC settings and not opposite! All my important and up to date bookmarks are now gone! and I am stuck with years old bookmarks on the main PC! Is there maybe a way to restore the bookmarks on the main PC and why does Firefox even overwrite new with old in the first place!??

title: Input control acts as if it is readonly
content:
Hello,

I have an HTML input control in a page that acts as if it is read-only until I activate a different window and then switch back to Firefox and my control - at that point it behaves as expected. In this initial state I can select with my mouse content. However, I cannot input or modify existing content. Right click > Select All has not effect. Copy does not work. I checked using document.elementsFromPoint() and is the top most element. I checked and in javascript it reports that it does not have readonly or disabled attribute. Trying to use the developer tools does not help because as soon as I activate that window, the control starts behaving as expected. This Windows 11, Firefox 96.0.3 (64-bit). Could you please tell me how can I investigate this any further?

Thank you, Bogdan
creator: bogdan_mabo

title: Strange issue likely involving Avast-1 of 4 accounts does not run firefox any longer.
content: I recently had installed Avast and after a few days, after running a scan on avast, it found and quarantined a "possible threat" string of code from firefox and my steam app. Unwittingly and to be honest, in a small hurry, I removed the quarantined items and went about my business. I have Windows accounts on my computer, 3 users and an admin. 2 users and the Admin can run FF, but the 1 user account cannot. I have tried some of the troubleshooting steps to create a new profile and have uninstalled the whole mozilla app. I really like the browser and am not having any luck getting FF to work on the one account. I have since uninstalled Avast and have UN and Re installed FF along with trying to create a new profile for my afflicted user account. No luck. When I click the FF app to start it, I get a white flash box, but too quick to read. Also, When I perform a run search for firefox.exe, Windows cannot find it, even though it is on my pc. Please help.

title: 403 ERROR trying to access https://donate.mozilla.org/help
content:
Hello Using Firefox-ESR, when attempting (multiple times) to access https://donate.mozilla.org/help I receive:

403 ERROR The request could not be satisfied. Request blocked. We can't connect to the server for this app or website at this time. There might be too much traffic or a configuration error. Try again later, or contact the app or website owner. If you provide content to customers through CloudFront, you can find steps to troubleshoot and help prevent this error by reviewing the CloudFront documentation.

Thank you in advance for any assistance you can provide.
